summary:
Extensive international experience gained within critical roles requiring advisory, policy reform and political/policy analysis skills, managed international donor-funded health/education projects with cross-cutting issues gender, sexual health, public health and human rights. International experience includes spells within the Former Soviet Union, Papua New Guinea, Central Asia, Bangladesh and Yemen. Twinning and health system reform programs for GIZ and lead innovative computer-based teaching tools for pre-service, post graduate education and practicing health care workers and teachers

Milestones Strategies development and International Standards: 
•	Lead the Infection Control (IC) Management training and computer-based e-training tools, based on WHO/UNICEF ICATT model, on Infection Control, Prevention of Bloodborn HAI infections and hospital management that meet the standards of WHO and CDC (2012). E-tool is currently nationwide rolled-out in Kyrgyzstan (2014/2015),
•	Initiated and provided TA for organisational development of (state) independent Associations of Midwives in Belarus (2004) Georgia (2009) Kyrgyzstan (2011) that meet WHO/ICM standards.
•	Established network Preparing for Birth Parents Schools in Russia (1998-2004), Ukraine (2003-2005) Kazakhstan (2004-2006) Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan (2006-2010); last ones were taken over by UNFPA and GIZ from 2012 onwards.
Currently: 
•	Development of e-learning tools for education sector in Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan on Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights for young people, for pre-service and post graduate teachers education, that meet WHO/UNESCO standards, 
•	Support to MoH UZ competence-based pre-service and post-graduate education for midwives meeting the WHO and ICM standards.

Proposal writing for SDC/GFA for a 10 million CHF project on Autnonomy for Health Services in Kyrgyzstan (it was the winning proposal)', 'title': 'International Team Leader for Kyrgzstan, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'GIZ/EUNIDA', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Almaty, Kazakhstan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'GIZ/EUNIDA', 'description': 'The overall objective of the project is to improve infectious disease prevention and control with special focus on Tuberculosis, HIV/AIDS and hepatitis C.
The project concentrates on disease control measures that are not sufficiently addressed by other funded projects. More in particular it focuses on increasing the role and involvement of nurses in infectious disease prevention and control. For this the project assists MOH Kazakhstan in reviewing the professional status of nurses and developing a set of competences that meet internaitonal standards. 
Together with UNICEF and CDC and supported by WHO we develop an ICATT (computer-based teaching tool) manual on prevention of blood born iatrogenic infections, aiming to enhance the safety of providers and users of health services. With Kazakh National Medical University a course Working with MARPS is developing, aiming to introduce client-centred care for TB/HIV/HCV+ people in main stream medical education. Stakeholders are Republican Sanitary and Epidemiological Services and the national TB and AIDS Centres. 
The key element of this project is the establishment of  sustainable institutional partnerships between local and EU peer instituties with the aim to transfer knowledge, institution building and capacity development. MOUs are signed with KNMU, Academic Medical Center Amsterdam and Amsterdam Global Health Institute including HIV Monitoring Foundation.', 'title': 'Support to the Kazakhstan Ministry of Health to improve infectious diseases prevention and control', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'ETC Crystal', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Georgia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'ETC Crystal', 'description': 'Initiated and implemented in cooperation with ETC Crystal, the Rotterdam Midwives School and International confederation of Midwives  and local partners Tbilisi State Medical University, HERA XXI and GOGA a project that had the following results

Result 1: Education for Midwives improved
Midwifery curriculum established at TSMU that meets international  (WHO/ICM) standards: a 4-years bachelor that prepares students to work as an independent health professional/obstetrician for physiological pregnancies, deliveries and perinatal period. 
Result 2: Midwives Association of Georigia established
MAG as the advocate for improved working conditions for midwives and instrumental in mobilizing forces to improve reproductive services for the population; and function as a discussion partner of the Ministry of Health for reviewing standards and protocols on sound midwifery practices. 

As this newly established organization is member of  the International Confederation of Midwives, access to the international community will be reinforced, e.g. through international sister-organizations, which will open avenues for Georgian midwives to participate actively at the international forum.', 'title': 'Enhancement of midwifery in Georgie', 'employment_type': None}]},
